articles.title: COVID kills another New Brunswicker
articles.content:
Article content
COVID-19 killed a New Brunswicker aged 65 or older between May 18-24, according to new data from the province.
There were no RSV or influenza deaths during that week.

articles.title: Bristol tops measles cases for 2025 as South West figures rise
articles.description: Bristol reports the highest number of measles cases in England so far this year.
articles.content:
Bristol sees a rise in measles cases
The latest figures show Bristol has the highest number of measles cases in the UK
A steep rise in measles has been revealed in the latest health data which also shows a low uptake for vaccines for children.

articles.title: WWDC 2025: iOS 26, Liquid Glass technology and what all to expect at Apple's developers conference
articles.description: At WWDC, Apple may introduce iOS 26, highlighting a 'Liquid Glass' interface that signifies a major design shift. This overhaul not only enhances aesthetics but also aligns version numbers across devices, signaling deeper integration in preparation for future innovations.
articles.content: Apple could offer a glimpse into its next era of user experience at the Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) today. The company is expected to unveil iOS 26, a major visual overhaul that signals the company’s boldest interface shift in more than a ... [1753 chars]

articles.title: Irish mum's warning to never kiss babies on lips after son suffers brain injury
articles.description: The three-year-old has been left with severe learning difficulties after contracting herpes simplex from a cold sore
articles.content:
An Irish mum has warned people never to kiss babies after her son contracted herpes simplex from a cold sore. Jed Scanlon was rushed to hospital by parents Amanda, 39, and David, 40, after he came down with a high temperature.
Little Jed was diagnose... [2526 chars]

articles.description: The Clare Potter's Market takes place on June 21 and 22 at Ballymorris Pottery.

articles.title: Volcanic Eruptions Can Create Ice in The Sky, And We Finally Know How
articles.description: Satellites soaring high above Earth have revealed exactly how wispy clouds are created by the giant plumes of ash belched upwards in a volcanic eruption.
